bill_title: to classify certain persons as residents for purposes of higher education tuition.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to classify certain persons as residents for purposes of higher education tuition. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-53 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, any person who graduates from a South Dakota high school qualifies for resident tuition rates at the institutions controlled by the Board of Regents if: (1) The person was a South Dakota resident at the time of high school graduation and lived with a parent or legal guardian who was also a South Dakota resident; (2) A parent or legal guardian of the individual resided continuously in South Dakota through the time of first attendance as provided in subdivision (3); and (3) The person begins to attend classes no later than the fall semester of the fifth year after the date of high school graduation. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to classify certain persons as residents for purposes of higher education tuition. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-53 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, any person who graduates from a South Dakota high school qualifies for resident tuition rates at the institutions controlled by the Board of Regents if: (1) The person was a South Dakota resident at the time of high school graduation and lived with a parent or legal guardian who was also a South Dakota resident; (2) A parent or legal guardian of the individual resided continuously in South Dakota through the time of first attendance as provided in subdivision (3); and (3) The person begins to attend classes no later than the fall semester of the tenth year after the date of high school graduation. S.J. 369 2/11/97 Motion to Amend, Failed. S.J. 394 2/11/97 Senate Do Pass, Passed, AYES 32, NAYS 3. S.J. 395 2/12/97 First read in House and referred to Education. H.J. 456 2/20/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/20/97 Education Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 11, NAYS 1. H.J. 600

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to classify certain persons as residents for purposes of higher education tuition. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-53 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, any person who graduates from a South Dakota high school qualifies for resident tuition rates at the institutions controlled by the Board of Regents if: (1) The person was a South Dakota resident at the time of high school graduation and lived with a parent or legal guardian who was also a South Dakota resident; (2) A parent or legal guardian of the individual resided continuously in South Dakota through the time of first attendance as provided in subdivision (3); and (3) The person begins to attend classes no later than the fall semester of the seventh year after the date of high school graduation.
